TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract ICallableStatement implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Sql.IPreparedStatement, class Java.Sql.IStatement, class Java.Sql.IWrapper, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: An interface used to call Stored Procedures.

remarks.para: An interface used to call Stored Procedures.

The JDBC API provides an SQL escape syntax allowing Stored Procedures to be called in a standard way for all databases. The JDBC escape syntax has two forms. One form includes a result parameter. The second form does not include a result parameter. Where the result parameter is used, it must be declared as an OUT parameter. Other parameters can be declared as IN, OUT, or INOUT. Parameters are referenced either by name or by a numerical index starting at 1.
CallableStatements can return one or more ResultSets. In the event that multiple ResultSets are returned, they are accessed using the methods inherited from the Statement interface.

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the specified JDBC DATE parameter as a java.sql.Date, using the specified Calendar to construct the date.

remarks.para: Gets the value of the specified JDBC DATE parameter as a java.sql.Date, using the specified Calendar to construct the date.
The JDBC driver uses the calendar to create the Date using a particular timezone and locale. The default behavior of the driver is to use the VM defaults. See "Be wary of the default locale".

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the specified parameter as a Java Object.

remarks.para: Gets the value of the specified parameter as a Java Object.

The object type returned is the JDBC type registered for the parameter with a registerOutParameter call. If a parameter was registered as a java.sql.Types.OTHER then it may hold abstract types that are particular to the connected database.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetString(int32 parameterIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: the parameter number index, where the first parameter has index 1.
Docs.summary: Returns the indexed parameter's value as a String.

remarks.para: Returns the indexed parameter's value as a String. The parameter value must be one of the JDBC types CHAR, VARCHAR or LONGVARCHAR.
The String corresponding to a CHAR of fixed length will be of identical length to the value in the database inclusive of padding characters.

Docs.exception: if there is a problem accessing the database.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RegisterOutParameter (int parameterIndex, int sqlType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RegisterOutParameter(int32 parameterIndex, int32 sqlType) cil managed

Docs.param: the parameter number index, where the first parameter has index 1
the JDBC type as defined by java.sql.Types. The JDBC types NUMERIC and DECIMAL should be defined using .
Docs.summary: Defines the type of a specified OUT parameter.

remarks.para: Defines the type of a specified OUT parameter. All OUT parameters must have their type defined before a stored procedure is executed.

The type supplied in the sqlType parameter fixes the type that will be returned by the getter methods of CallableStatement. If a database specific type is expected for a parameter, the Type java.sql.Types.OTHER should be used. Note that there is another variant of this method for User Defined Types or a REF type.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RegisterOutParameter (string parameterName, int sqlType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RegisterOutParameter(string parameterName, int32 sqlType) cil managed

Docs.param: a JDBC type expressed as a constant from . Types NUMERIC and DECIMAL should be defined using the variant of this method that takes a scale parameter.
Docs.summary: Defines the Type of a specified OUT parameter.

remarks.para: Defines the Type of a specified OUT parameter. All OUT parameters must have their Type defined before a stored procedure is executed.

The type supplied in the sqlType parameter fixes the type that will be returned by the getter methods of CallableStatement. If a database-specific type is expected for a parameter, the Type java.sql.Types.OTHER should be used. Note that there is another variant of this method for User Defined Types or a REF type.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RegisterOutParameter (int parameterIndex, int sqlType, int scale);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RegisterOutParameter(int32 parameterIndex, int32 sqlType, int32 scale) cil managed

Docs.param: the parameter number index, where the first parameter has index 1
the JDBC type as defined by java.sql.Types.
the number of digits after the decimal point. Must be greater than or equal to 0.
Docs.summary: Defines the Type of a specified OUT parameter.

remarks.para: Defines the Type of a specified OUT parameter. All OUT parameters must have their type defined before a stored procedure is executed. This version of the registerOutParameter method, which has a scale parameter, should be used for the JDBC types NUMERIC and DECIMAL, where there is a need to specify the number of digits expected after the decimal point.
The type supplied in the sqlType parameter fixes the type that will be returned by the getter methods of CallableStatement.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RegisterOutParameter (int paramIndex, int sqlType, string typeName);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RegisterOutParameter(int32 paramIndex, int32 sqlType, string typeName) cil managed

Docs.param: the parameter number index, where the first parameter has index 1.
a JDBC type expressed as a constant from .
an SQL type name. For a REF type, this name should be the fully qualified name of the referenced type.
Docs.summary: Defines the Type of a specified OUT parameter.

remarks.para: Defines the Type of a specified OUT parameter. This variant of the method is designed for use with parameters that are User Defined Types (UDT) or a REF type, although it can be used for any type.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RegisterOutParameter (string parameterName, int sqlType, int scale);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RegisterOutParameter(string parameterName, int32 sqlType, int32 scale) cil managed

Docs.param: a JDBC type expressed as a constant from .
the number of digits after the decimal point. Must be greater than or equal to 0.
Docs.summary: Defines the Type of a specified OUT parameter.

remarks.para: Defines the Type of a specified OUT parameter. All OUT parameters must have their Type defined before a stored procedure is executed. This version of the registerOutParameter method, which has a scale parameter, should be used for the JDBC types NUMERIC and DECIMAL, where there is a need to specify the number of digits expected after the decimal point.
The type supplied in the sqlType parameter fixes the type that will be returned by the getter methods of CallableStatement.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RegisterOutParameter (string parameterName, int sqlType, string typeName);

Docs.summary: Sets the value of a specified parameter to the content of a supplied InputStream, which has a specified number of bytes.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter to the content of a supplied InputStream, which has a specified number of bytes.

This is a good method for setting an SQL LONGVARCHAR parameter where the length of the data is large. Data is read from the InputStream until end-of-file is reached or the specified number of bytes is copied.

a Calendar to use to construct the SQL DATE value.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of a specified parameter to a supplied java.sql.Date value, using a supplied calendar to map the date.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter to a supplied java.sql.Date value, using a supplied calendar to map the date. The calendar allows the application to control the timezone used to compute the SQL DATE in the database. In case that no calendar is supplied, the driver uses the default timezone of the Java virtual machine.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter to SQL NULL. Don't use this version of setNull for User Defined Types (UDT) or for REF type parameters.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetNull (string parameterName, int sqlType, string typeName);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetNull(string parameterName, int32 sqlType, string typeName) cil managed

Docs.param: a JDBC type expressed as a constant from .
if the target parameter is a user defined type then this should contain the full type name. The fully qualified name of a UDT or REF type is ignored if the parameter is not a UDT.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of a specified parameter to be SQL NULL where the parameter type is either REF or user defined (e.g.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter to be SQL NULL where the parameter type is either REF or user defined (e.g. STRUCT , JAVA_OBJECT etc).

For reasons of portability, the caller is expected to supply both the SQL type code and type name (which is just the parameter name if the type is user defined, referred to as a UDT, or the name of the referenced type in case of a REF type).

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetObject (string parameterName, Java.Lang.Object theObject);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetObject(string parameterName, class Java.Lang.Object theObject) cil managed

Docs.param: the new value with which to update the parameter
Docs.summary: Sets the value of a specified parameter using a supplied object.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter using a supplied object. Prior to issuing this request to the connected database theObject is transformed to the corresponding SQL type according to the standard Java to SQL mapping rules.

If the object's class implements the interface SQLData, the JDBC driver calls SQLData.writeSQL to write it to the SQL data stream. If theObject implements any of the following interfaces then the driver is in charge of mapping the value to the appropriate SQL type.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetObject (string parameterName, Java.Lang.Object theObject, int targetSqlType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetObject(string parameterName, class Java.Lang.Object theObject, int32 targetSqlType) cil managed

Docs.param: the new value with which to update the parameter.
a JDBC type expressed as a constant from .
Docs.summary: Sets the value of a specified parameter using a supplied object.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter using a supplied object.

The parameter theObject is converted to the given targetSqlType before it is sent to the database. If the object has a custom mapping (its class implements the interface SQLData), the JDBC driver calls the method SQLData.writeSQL to write it to the SQL data stream. If theObject is an instance of one of the following types
then the driver is in charge of mapping the value to the appropriate SQL type and deliver it to the database.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetObject (string parameterName, Java.Lang.Object theObject, int targetSqlType, int scale);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetObject(string parameterName, class Java.Lang.Object theObject, int32 targetSqlType, int32 scale) cil managed

a JDBC type expressed as a constant from .
where applicable, the number of digits after the decimal. point.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of a specified parameter using a supplied object.

remarks.para: Sets the value of a specified parameter using a supplied object.

The object is converted to the given targetSqlType before it is sent to the database. If the object has a custom mapping (its class implements the interface SQLData), the JDBC driver calls the method SQLData.writeSQL to write it to the SQL data stream. If theObject implements any of the following interfaces
then the driver is charge of mapping the value to the appropriate SQL type.

Docs.param: the new value with which to update the parameter.
used for creating the new SQL TIME value.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of the parameter named parameterName to the value of the supplied java.sql.Time using the supplied calendar.

remarks.para: Sets the value of the parameter named parameterName to the value of the supplied java.sql.Time using the supplied calendar.
The driver uses the supplied Calendar to create the SQL TIME value, which allows it to use a custom timezone - otherwise the driver uses the VM defaults. See "Be wary of the default locale".
